info.p: PDF/A-2 is a format created by subsetting the PDF 1.7 (ISO 32000-1) format, with the aim of prohibiting features unsuitable for long-term archiving, such as font linking (as opposed to font embedding) and encryption. PDF/A-1 files will not necessarily conform to PDF/A-2, and PDF/A-2 compliant files will not necessarily conform to PDF/A-1. PDF/A-2 offers the following new features over PDF/A-1:

ul.li: support for transparency effects and layers
provisions for digital signatures in accordance with the PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures â€“ PAdES standard
the option of embedding PDF/A files to facilitate archiving of sets of documents with a single file.

info.p: Other formats in the PDF/A family are as follows:

ul.li: PDF/A-3: "Part 3: Use of ISO 32000-1 with support for embedded files" (2012-10-15)

info.p: Centres should note that Part 1 references an obsolete version of PDF, while parts 2 and 3 reference the fully open PDF 1.7.
For more details, see a Wikipedia overview or consult the standards documents, where available.
VeraPDF is an open-source validator for PDF/A formats.
